description: This workflow accomplishes the task of stopping traffic on a specified interface by first creating and then applying a deny ACL with specific network attributes on that interface.
name: drop_provision

acl_exists.description: Indicates is the acl already exists.

address_type.description: The address type IPv4 IPv6 or MAC used to create the acl.

destination.description: The destination MAC in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format or destination IPv4 or IPv6 address, including tcp and udp port numbers. { any | D_IPaddress mask | host D_IPaddress } [ destination-operator [ D_port-numbers ] ]

dscp.description: The DSCP value to match against. This can be either a numerical value or DSCP name.

dst_mac_addr_mask.description: The dst_mac_addr_mask - the mask for destination MAC in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format.

ethertype.description: The EtherType, can be 'arp', 'fcoe', 'ipv4' or custom value between 1536 and 65535.

intf_name.description: The interface name as an array (182/0/97).

intf_type.description: The interface type gigabitethernet or tengigabitethernet, etc.

protocol_type.description: The Protocol Number Custom value between 0 and 255, tcp, udp, icmp or ip.

seq_id.description: The sequence number of the rule, if not specified, the rule is added at the end of the list. Valid range is 0 to 4294967290.

source.description: The source MAC in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format or source IPv4 or IPv6 address, including tcp and udp port numbers. { any | S_IPaddress mask | host S_IPaddress } [ source-operator [ S_port-numbers ] ]

src_mac_addr_mask.description: The src_mac_addr_mask - the mask for source MAC in HHHH.HHHH.HHHH format.

vlan_id.description: The VLAN interface to which the ACL is bound.
